normalized_lines: 1 1/2 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 large red onion, cut into wedges
1. Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment.
2. In a large bowl, toss chicken with olive oil, honey, garlic, salt, pepper, and paprika. Let sit 10 minutes while you prep vegetables.
3. In another bowl, toss onion, broccolini, and mushrooms with 1 tbsp olive oil, chili flakes, and a pinch of salt.
4. Arrange chicken on one side of the tray and vegetables on the other side; roast 18 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, whisk soy sauce, vinegar, cornstarch, sesame oil, and 2 tbsp water. If very thick, add 1 more tbsp water.
6. Remove tray, toss chicken with sauce, and return to oven for 8 to 10 minutes, until glossy and cooked through.
7. Taste vegetables; season with extra salt if needed.
8. Serve over rice and top with scallions and sesame seeds.
Note: If your pan is crowded, split between 2 trays so everything roasts instead of steams.

target_recipe.title: Ultimate Weeknight Sheet-Pan Dinner (Serves 4 to 6)
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 large red onion, cut into wedges
steps: 1. Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment.
2. In a large bowl, toss chicken with olive oil, honey, garlic, salt, pepper, and paprika. Let sit 10 minutes while you prep vegetables.
3. In another bowl, toss onion, broccolini, and mushrooms with 1 tbsp olive oil, chili flakes, and a pinch of salt.
4. Arrange chicken on one side of the tray and vegetables on the other side; roast 18 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, whisk soy sauce, vinegar, cornstarch, sesame oil, and 2 tbsp water. If very thick, add 1 more tbsp water.
6. Remove tray, toss chicken with sauce, and return to oven for 8 to 10 minutes, until glossy and cooked through.
7. Taste vegetables; season with extra salt if needed.
8. Serve over rice and top with scallions and sesame seeds.
notes: Note: If your pan is crowded, split between 2 trays so everything roasts instead of steams.
